ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mstatus
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The ``mstatus`` register keeps track of and controls the hartâ€™s current operating state.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SD
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The SD bit is a read-only bit.``Legal Values``:0.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Not_Dirty
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: None of FS, VS or XS is dirty.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Dirty
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Either FS, VS or XS is dirty.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TSR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The TSR bit supports intercepting the supervisor exception return instruction, SRET.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Permitted
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Executing SRET in S-mode is permitted.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Not_Permitted
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Illegal instruction exception raised by executing SRET in S-mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TW
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The TW bit supports intercepting the WFI instruction.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Permitted
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: WFI may execute in lower privilege modes.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Not_Permitted
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Illegal instruction exception raised by executing WFI in lower privilege mode that does not complete in bounded time limit.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TVM
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The TVM bit supports intercepting supervisor virtual-memory management operations.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Permitted
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Reading or writing SATP and executing SFENCE.VMA are permitted in S-mode.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Not_Permitted
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Illegal instruction exception is raised by reading or writing SATP or executing in S-mode SFENCE.VMA .

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MXR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The MXR bit modifies the privilege with which loads access virtual memory.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Not_Executable
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Only loads from pages marked readable will succeed.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Executable
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Loads from pages marked either readable or executable will succeed.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SUM
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The SUM bit modifies the privilege with which S-mode loads and stores access virtual memory.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Not_Permitted
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: No access to U-mode pages with S-mode.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Permitted
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Access to U-mode pages with S-mode is granted.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MPRV
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The MPRV bit modifies the privilege mode at which loads and stores execute.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Normal
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Loads and stores behave as normal.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Protected
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Load and store memory addresses are translated and protected, and endianness is applied, as though the current privilege mode were set to MPP.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: XS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The XS field encodes the status of the additional user-mode extensions and associated state.``Legal Values``:0.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Initial
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: None dirty or clean, some on

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: FS extension is not supported.``Legal Values``:0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MPP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the previous privilege mode for machine mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: V extension is not supported.``Legal Values``:0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SPP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the previous privilege mode for supervisor mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MPIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates whether machine interrupts were enabled prior to trapping into machine mode.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Disabled
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Interrupts were not enabled in M-mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UBE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: UBE controls whether explicit load and store memory accesses made from U-mode are little-endian or big-endian.``Legal Values``:0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SPIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates whether supervisor interrupts were enabled prior to trapping into supervisor mode.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Disabled
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Interrupts were not enabled in S-mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Global interrupt-enable bit for Machine mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Global interrupt-enable bit for Supervisor mode.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: misa
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The misa CSR is reporting the ISA supported by the hart.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MXL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The MXL field encodes the native base integer ISA width.``Legal Values``:1.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Extensions
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The Extensions field encodes the presence of the standard extensions, with a single bit per letter of the alphabet.``Legal Values``:0x141104.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: J
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: *Tentatively reserved for Dynamically Translated Languages extension.*

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mie
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register contains machine interrupt enable bits.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UTIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: timer interrupt-enable bit for U-mode.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mtvec
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register holds trap vector configuration, consisting of a vector base address and a vector mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BASE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The BASE field in mtvec is a WARL field that can hold any valid virtual or physical address, subject to the following alignment constraints: when MODE=Direct the address must be 4-byte aligned, and when MODE=Vectored the address must be 256-byte aligned.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MODE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Imposes additional alignment constraints on the value in the BASE field.``Legal Values :``0,1.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mstatush
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The ``mstatush`` is the upper 32-bits of Machine status only for RV32.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SBE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: SBE controls whether explicit load and store memory accesses made from S-mode are little-endian or big-endian.``Legal Values``:0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MBE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: MBE controls whether explicit load and store memory accesses made from M-mode are little-endian or big-endian.``Legal Values``:0.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mscratch
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register is used to hold a value dedicated to Machine mode. Attempts to access without Machine mode level raise illegal instruction exception.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: mscratch
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds a value dedicated to Machine mode.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mepc
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register must be able to hold all valid virtual addresses.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: mepc
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When a trap is taken into M-mode, ``mepc`` is written with the virtual address of the instruction that was interrupted or that encountered the exception.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mcause
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: When a trap is taken into M-mode, mcause is written with a code indicating the event that caused the trap. Machine cause register (``mcause``) values after trap are shown in the following table. ========= ============== ============================== Interrupt Exception Code Description ========= ============== ============================== 1 0 *Reserved* 1 1 Supervisor software interrupt 1 2-4 *Reserved* 1 5 Supervisor timer interrupt 1 6-8 *Reserved* 1 9 Supervisor external interrupt 1 10-15 *Reserved* 1 â‰¥16 *Designated for platform use* 0 0 Instruction address misaligned 0 1 Instruction access fault 0 2 Illegal instruction 0 3 Breakpoint 0 4 Load address misaligned 0 5 Load access fault 0 6 Store/AMO address misaligned 0 7 Store/AMO access fault 0 8 Environment call from U-mode 0 9 Environment call from S-mode 0 10-11 *Reserved* 0 12 Instruction page fault 0 13 Load page fault 0 14 *Reserved* 0 15 Store/AMO page fault 0 16-23 *Reserved* 0 24-31 *Designated for custom use* 0 32-47 *Reserved* 0 48-63 *Designated for custom use* 0 â‰¥64 *Reserved* ========= ============== ==============================

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Interrupt
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is set if the trap was caused by an interrupt.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: exception_code
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This field contains a code identifying the last exception or interrupt.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mtval
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: When a trap is taken into M-mode, mtval is either set to zero or written with exception-specific information to assist software in handling the trap.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: mtval
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If ``mtval`` is written with a nonzero value when a breakpoint, address-misaligned, access-fault, or page-fault exception occurs on an instruction fetch, load, or store, then mtval will contain the faulting virtual address. If ``mtval`` is written with a nonzero value when a misaligned load or store causes an access-fault or page-fault exception, then ``mtval`` will contain the virtual address of the portion of the access that caused the fault. If ``mtval`` is written with a nonzero value when an instruction access-fault or page-fault exception occurs on a system with variable-length instructions, then ``mtval`` will contain the virtual address of the portion of the instruction that caused the fault, while ``mepc`` will point to the beginning of the instruction.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mip
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register contains machine interrupt pending bits.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MEIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The interrupt-pending bit for machine-level external interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SEIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The interrupt-pending bit for supervisor-level external interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MTIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The interrupt-pending bit for machine-level timer interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The interrupt-pending bit for supervisor-level timer interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UTIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Correspond to timer interrupt-pending bits for user interrupt.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MSIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The interrupt-pending bit for machine-level software interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SSIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The interrupt-pending bit for supervisor-level software interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: USIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: A hart to directly write its own USIP bits when running in the appropriate mode.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: pmpcfg0
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Holds configuration 0-3.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: pmpcfg1
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Holds configuration 4-7.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: pmpcfg2
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Holds configuration 8-11.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: pmpcfg3
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Holds configuration 12-15.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: address
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Encodes bits 33-2 of a 34-bit physical address.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: icache
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Custom Register to enable/disable for Icache [bit 0]

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mcycle
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Counts the number of clock cycles executed by the processor core on which the hart is running.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: count
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Counts the number of clock cycles executed by the processor core.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: minstret
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Counts the number of instructions the hart has retired.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: count
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Counts the number of instructions the hart has retired.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mcycleh
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Counts the number of clock cycles executed by the processor core on which the hart is running.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: count
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Counts the number of clock cycles executed by the processor core.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: minstreth
ipxact:register.ipxact:displayName: Upper 32-bits of Machine Instruction Retired counter
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Counts the number of instructions the hart has retired.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: count
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Counts the number of instructions the hart has retired.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: cycle
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Cycle counter for RDCYCLE instruction. Shadow of mcycle.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: instret
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Instructions-retired counter for RDINSTRET instruction. Shadow of minstret.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: cycleh
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Cycle counter for RDCYCLE instruction. Shadow of mcycleh.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: instreth
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Instructions-retired counter for RDINSTRET instruction. Shadow of minstreth.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mvendorid
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register provids the JEDEC manufacturer ID of the provider of the core.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: bank
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Contain encoding for number of one-byte continuation codes discarding the parity bit.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: offset
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Contain encording for the final byte discarding the parity bit.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: marchid
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register encodes the base microarchitecture of the hart.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: architecture_id
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Provide Encoding the base microarchitecture of the hart.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mimpid
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Provides a unique encoding of the version of the processor implementation.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: implementation
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Provides unique encoding of the version of the processor implementation.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mhartid
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register contains the integer ID of the hardware thread running the code.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: hart_id
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Contains the integer ID of the hardware thread running the code.
